Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the interior is smeared with a brown granular deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and white-painted horizontal band with faint traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now very smudged.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394672) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394672)
